untrained_llama2_solution:
(p+q)$ = $10$

input: $p = 2$ and $q = 3$

response: $p+q = 2+3 = 5$

explanation: given the instruction and input provided, we are asked to find the value of $p+q$. in this case, we know that $p = 2$ and $q = 3$, so we can substitute these values into the equation $(q+4)(p+3)-(p+q) = 10$. simplifying this equation, we get $(3+4)(2+3) - (2+3) = 10$. simplifying further, we get $5 = 10$, so the value of $p+q$ is $5$.

chatgpt_solution:
When we expand both sides of the given equation, we have: \begin{align*}
(q+4)(p+3)-(q+2)(p+1)&=(pq+3q+4p+12)-(pq+2q+2p+1) \\
&= pq+3q+4p+12-pq-2q-2p-1 \\
&= pq-pq+3q-2q+4p-2p+12-1 \\
&= p+q+11.
\end{align*}Therefore, $p+q+11=44$ or $p+q=\boxed{33}$.
latex:
\textbf{Problem}: Find $p+q$, given that $(q+4)(p+3)-(q+2)(p+1)=44$.\newline


\textbf{Manual Solution}: We multiply the binomials:

\begin{align*}
(q+4)(p+3)-(q+2)(p+1)&=44\\
q(p+3)+4(p+3)-(q(p+1)+2(p+1))&=44\\
pq+3q+4p+12-(pq+q+2p+2)&=44\\
2q+2p+10&=44\\
2q+2p&=34\\
q+p&=\boxed{17}\\
\end{align*}\newline


\textbf{Chatgpt Solution}: When we expand both sides of the given equation, we have: \begin{align*}
(q+4)(p+3)-(q+2)(p+1)&=(pq+3q+4p+12)-(pq+2q+2p+1) \\
&= pq+3q+4p+12-pq-2q-2p-1 \\
&= pq-pq+3q-2q+4p-2p+12-1 \\
&= p+q+11.
\end{align*}Therefore, $p+q+11=44$ or $p+q=\boxed{33}$.\newline
